intro: Newtonia suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented Newtonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while its bark is thick and fissured. The sweet fragrance of its flowers attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
